results.title: Linderidge 137
results.creator_credit: Paul Denby and New Cinema Workshop
results.brief_description: Investigates the conventions of storytelling and suspense. The central theme examines the process whereby women in film are represented as the victims of threat and aggression, as the object of the camera’s voyeuristic gaze.
results.description: Investigates the conventions of storytelling and suspense. The central theme examines the process whereby women in film are represented as the victims of threat and aggression, as the object of the camera’s voyeuristic gaze.

results.title: Lights that never fail
results.brief_description: At an international conference in London, men of many nations are seen as they meet to discuss the problems of safeguarding life at sea. The film then shows the work of the men who keep the lighthouses, and how their faithful attention to duty protects people of different countries and of all races.

results.title: Light play
results.brief_description: An abstract experiment in colour, light, shapes and sound using rapid succession of scratched, dyed, painted and cut frames to a minimalist soundtrack creating a mesmeric cinematic reverie.

results.title: Light in the jungle
results.creator_credit: Seventh Day Adventist Public Relations Dept
results.brief_description: The challenge of the South Pacific. Fiji has a coconut based economy which has produced new wealth and new problems for the people; learning the value of labour and the use of money. Tells of the combined efforts of government officials and missionaries to solve these problems. Graduates of the Seventh Day Adventist Medical Training College in Lae, New Guinea, help village people learn personal hygiene, and sanitation as well as how to overcome fears and superstitions.

results.title: Lifting patients. Part 2. In the home
results.creator_credit: Great Britain. Ministry of Health and Kinocraft
results.brief_description: Demonstrates lifting techniques and explains the principle on which they are based, which removes the possibility of spinal injuries and strain. Primarily for district nurses, health visitors and others in the field of domiciliary nursing and could also be extremely useful to relatives who are nursing patients at home.

results.title: Lifting
results.creator_credit: George Wynn and CWS Film Unit for Ministry of Labour
results.brief_description: Thousands of men and women injure themselves in lifting or moving heavy weights. This films shows the right way to tackle a number of jobs so as to avoid accidents and strains and to make the jobs themselves easier.

results.title: Life. Be in it
results.creator_credit: Victorian Department of Youth, Sport and Recreation
results.brief_description: Phillip Adams conceived and developed the “Life Be In It” advertising campaign aimed at encouraging the community to become more involved in physical activity and recreation. Includes examples of television commercials featuring characters such as Norm, the average all-round armchair sportsman.

results.title: Life in North China
results.brief_description: The mountains of Manchuria are dotted with rural communes - farm villages operating as production teams, working the land on a collective basis. While many of the farming techniques are primitive, the people are building towards an efficient tomorrow by operating small basic industries. Some are constructing their own chemical fertiliser plants and agricultural colleges. Their spirit of self-sufficiency and co-operation has its parallel in the urban industrial centres, where factory workers often build their own essential manufacturing equipment, and all major decisions in the plant are made by a committee of workers, technicians, and management officers. At harvest time, thousands of teachers, students and workers leave the cities to work beside their countrymen in the fields. Later, on National Liberation Day, these two life-styles merge again in celebration of their growing nation.

results.title: Life in China: mill worker's family
results.creator_credit: Richard Sanderson and Department of Photography and Cinema, Ohio State University
results.brief_description: One of a series of films about contemporary life in Mainland China. Reveals the family life of a skilled cotton-mill worker, his wife, son and grandmother. The family is seen at work, at home, at study and enjoying leisure as a three generation family on their duty off in Peking’s Park.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Sanderson and Department of Photography and Cinema, Ohio State University
